item.title: DUCT LEAK Detection Systems – Test Function

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided detection system is verified to be operative once each flight day.

placard.para: Placard the DUCT LEAK TEST Switch (P61) "TEST INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Two procedures are available. Perform either Procedure One or Procedure Two.

numlitem.para: Ensure that the detection loop(s) operate normally by the following method.

Use a heat source of approximately 260°F to heat a section of the detector element (loops are accessible through the respective ECS bay). The required substitute test heat device must not produce heat greater than 450°F (232°C). This temperature limit should be observed in the event that fuel vapors exist in this area.
Gain access to the Duct Leak and Wheel Well Fire Control Card M691 on the Electrical System Card File P50 in the Main Equipment Center.
Record fault code (if any) until code 97 (memory read complete) appears.
The following can be used to decipher the MEM READ two digit (XY) code.
The above XY codes indicate a defective element. Ensure at least one loop (A or B) is operative for each of the above (X) zones.
XY codes other than those listed above require more maintenance. Consult Maintenance Manual/Fault Isolation procedures 26-18-00.
